newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - May 30.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - May 30.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on May 30. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
President Suharto said he was satisfied with Thursday's general election and asked everybody to continue counting the votes in line with regulations and not to over-react.
President Suharto said he was satisfied with Thursday's smooth election and hoped order would be maintained until the final results were released.
The government issued a presidential decree which raising salaries of civil servants at all levels. The increases ranged from 33.4 percent to 73 percent effective from from April 1.

Hundreds of supporters of a minority party contesting Thursday's elections attacked a government office in Sampang, Madura island, because the ruling party Golkar won the polls in the area. No injuries or causualties were reported.
Minister of Economics, Finance and Supervisor of Development Saleh Affif said it the ministry will extend deregulation in the manufacturing sector in June and modify the negative investment list.
